properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 4 at 9:14PM PST until February 5 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
One band of light snow has moved through the region. Snow will
redevelop around midnight and increase in intensity over portions
of southeastern Washington and the Idaho Panhandle early Wednesday
morning.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches in
downtown Lewiston and 5 to 8 inches on Lewiston Grade and around
Gifford and Southwick.

* WHERE...Lewiston, Lapwai, Peck, Culdesac, Gifford, and
Lewiston Grade.

* WHEN...Until noon PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will increase in intensity overnight
and continue into Wednesday afternoon.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST WEDNESDAY
